newsitem.title: USA: LecTec gets U.S. patent for weight control method.
newsitem.headline: LecTec gets U.S. patent for weight control method.

text.p: LecTec Corp said Thursday it received a U.S. patent for a therapeutic method which may help control human body weight.
The method uses cotinine, a non-addictive substance related to nicotine.
LecTec said it owns the worldwide rights for the use of cotinine to help people quit smoking.

"There is preliminary evidence to suggest that a non-nicotine, cotinine-based pill may reduce the craving for cigarettes," LecTec chairman, chief executive and president Rodney Young said. "Cotinine may also be an effective tool for the long-term management of weight."
LecTec said its patents cover various delivery systems for cotinine, including patches, chewing gum and sprays.
LecTec provides products based on skin interface technologies, suck as diagnostic electrodes and conductive hydrogels, as well as other medical products.
